title: Connect, Trust, Invest : Africa
description: The perception of Africa as backwards and corrupt is holding back development and critical investment in its young & dynamic population

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposer has identified a problem and a solution to address the problem. It is unclear how the solution will work (how the investors will safely connect with talent and ideas in Africa? - by using a dedicated platform, or is something else?).

No KPIs/metrics are defined to measure the outcome of the working plan and no timetable with achievable milestones is defined.

It is not clear how the use of Cardano ecosystem will benefit both the community and the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal is just an idea with no relevant details for a working plan.

The proposer doesn't provide evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal (who is going the work?).

The budget is not broken down into identifiable items ($8000 are to spend on what? - salaries, stationary etc.) and the proposal is not aware of the resources needed to implement the proposal.

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. (what are the constrains for successfully implement the proposal?).
f6_assessments.q2:
Few information are available and is unclear what the solution is able to deliver or to solve.

No roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement is provided. (what is to be done in a time period).

Possible challenges are not considered. In conclusion, the progress of this proposal is hard to assess.

f6_assessments.q0: A platform to connect investors with talent in Africa will be helpful and also helping investors to track the funding will increase the possibility of getting investments. This addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has required experience but a detailed plan would have helped to track the possibility of the proposal being implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does not have fund breakdown details or no timeline has been mentioned. This makes it hard to follow the progress of the proposal and will be hard to track the success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: The problem statement is development and investment in Africa is being held back due to the perception as backwards and corrupt the proposer is try to resolve the issue with the help smart contract which will be help to track the progress of idea and flow of funds this will be very help to  reduce corruption as well as it will also increase the confidence of investors to invest on ideas and talents in Africa hence it effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has given a generic experience and hasn't mentioned any experience in past blockchain related projects. They haven't given any steps for implementation of the proposal. If a clear roadmap was provided this would have established more promising deliverability. therefore it's unlikely this proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer hasn't provided any details on timeframe and hasn't provided fund breakdown due to which it would be hard to track the process and success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: The general thrust of the proposal is inline with the with the Fund 6 brief however there is no clearly defined solution here.  The author admits he is seeking feedback on his very well intentioned ideas, but this proposal is not yet at a funding stage.
f6_assessments.q1: There is ample evidence given of problems which need to be addressed, and ideas of how blockchains and Cardano could address these problems, however there is no clearly defined path forward.  The author has requested some community assistance which is to be commended.   I do not believe this proposal will be funded in it's current state.
f6_assessments.q2: The project does not define a roadmap, KPI's, or any milestones by which to measure the success of the campaign.  I sincerely hope not to dampen the enthusiasm of the author, but to suggest he/she return at a later date with a clear plan.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is not very concrete and more a pitch than a concrete proposal, as the proposer admits by themselves. While getting outside investors can be both an upside and a downside depending on the investing, the proposer does not present how to mamage this concretely.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposer knows Plutus apart from that they don't really seem to have a concrete plan on how to approach the idea. The budget does not have a rationale.
f6_assessments.q2: No milestones exist and the plan is really vague, so this proposal can not really be audited.
